meanings.definition: Consisting of or displaying only one color or shades of one color.
meanings.sent1: The room was decorated in a monochrome color scheme, with everything in shades of gray.
meanings.sent2: She wore a monochrome outfit, with a black top and matching black pants.
meanings.sent3: The monochrome painting of a single tree in a field looked like a grayscale photograph.
meanings.sent4: His monochrome world seemed dull and lifeless, lacking the vibrancy of colors.
meanings.sent5: The artist's monochrome masterpiece captured the essence of simplicity and elegance.

meanings.definition: A painting, drawing, or photograph in monochrome.
meanings.sent1: The art gallery featured a stunning monochrome of a city skyline at night.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to work on monochromes, finding beauty in the simplicity of black and white.
meanings.sent3: The monochrome on the wall seemed to come alive, drawing viewers into its grayscale world.
meanings.sent4: His collection of monochromes told a story of light and shadow, without the distraction of color.
meanings.sent5: The monochrome captured the stillness of a winter morning, with snow-covered trees standing out in stark contrast.
